Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the significance of the lawsuit by referring to it as "one of the biggest private lawsuits against Medicare fraud in history."
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide specific evidence or data to support the statement that it is one of the biggest lawsuits in history.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the government's decision not to pursue the case was due to lack of awareness of the details, without providing evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative reasons why the government chose not to intervene in the case, such as lack of resources or prioritization of other cases.
